meaningMnemonic: This is a strange word, so you'll have to bear with me. You know that 知 means <kanji>know</kanji>. But in the case of this word, what do you know? Look at the second half. らせ sounds a bit like "race." So, you know about a "race." How do you know about this race? You got a <vocabulary>notice</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>notification</vocabulary> about it.
readingMnemonic: Remember 知る? This is the same reading (し). So, if you know that, you'll be able to read this one as well.
